qas.question: Castillan armies invaded Galicia between which years?
Which powerful Galician lords did they murder?

answers.text: Pedro Madruga, and Rodrigo Henriquez Osorio

qas.question: Which Castillan ruler then consolidated control over Galicia?

context: The modern period of the kingdom of Galicia began with the murder or defeat of some of the most powerful Galician lords, such as Pedro Álvarez de Sotomayor, called <a1_0>Pedro Madruga, and Rodrigo Henriquez Osorio<a1_0/>, at the hands of the Castilian armies sent to Galicia between the years <a0_0>1480 and 1486<a0_0/>. <a2_0>Isabella I<a2_0/> of Castile, considered a usurper by many Galician nobles, eradicated all armed resistance and definitively established the royal power of the Castilian monarchy. Fearing a general revolt, the monarchs ordered the banishing of the rest of the great lords like Pedro de Bolaño, Diego de Andrade or Lope Sánchez de Moscoso, among others.
